metadata.Title: CVE-2010-0305 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ejabberd_c2s.erl in ejabberd before 2.1.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (daemon crash) via a large number of c2s (aka client2server) messages that trigger a queue overload.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-0305` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ejabberd - 2.1.11-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ejabberd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.11-1ubuntu2.1').
